item.title: Sqlalchemy Tips and Trics
item.description: SQLAlchemy tips and tricks Here is collection of some unobvious SQLAlchemy tips and tricks. Split the database read/write operations over master/slave instances Let’s assume thta we have the master -> slave replications and want to split the database operations between master and slave: reading from slave, writing to master. The section Custom Vertical Partitioning of sqlalchemy docs will help us: from sqlalchemy import create_engine engines = { 'master': create_engine('postgresql://user:pass@master-host:5432/db'), 'slave': create_engine('postgresql://user:pass@slave-host:5432/db') } class DistributedSession(Session): def get_bind(self, mapper=None, clause=None): if self.
